Trial_Design.evidence: Surgical trainees were divided into intervention and control groups.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received training in surgical cognitive simulation (SCS) and was asked to apply the techniques while working in operating theatres.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Both groups underwent procedure-based assessment based on the UK and Ireland Intercollegiate Surgical Curriculum Programme (ISCP) before the training and 4 months afterwards.

Result_Outcome.evidence: there was a statistically significant improvement in 11 of 16 procedure-based assessment domains ( P < 0.050) as well as a statistically significant mean reduction in time to complete the procedure in the intervention group (–15.98 versus –1.14 min; P = 0.024).
